Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Contactapp’s views¶

The views module contains functions that define what should happen when a user visits a certain URL.

contactapp.views.contact_list(request)¶

The contact_list function is a view that displays all contacts in the database. It uses the Django Paginator class to paginate results, and it passes those results to the contact_list.html template for rendering.

Parameters:

request – Get the current user

Returns:

The contact_list

Doc-author:

Trelent

contactapp.views.create_contact(request)¶

The create_contact function is a view that allows the user to create a new contact. The function first checks if the request method is POST, which means that the form has been submitted. If it’s not POST, then we’re creating a blank form for them to fill out and render it in our template. If it’s POST, then we take data from our bound form (form) and save it to our database.

Parameters:

request – Get the request from the browser

Returns:

A response

Doc-author:

Trelent

contactapp.views.delete_contact(request, pk)¶

The delete_contact function is a view that allows the user to delete a contact. The function takes in two arguments: request and pk. The request argument is an HTTP request object, while the pk argument represents the primary key of a Contact object. The function first gets an instance of Contact with id equal to pk and user equal to the current logged-in user (or returns 404 if no such instance exists). If this is a POST request, then it deletes the contact and redirects back to the list of contacts; otherwise, it renders ‘contactapp/delete_contact.html

Parameters:

  • request – Get the request object

  • pk – Identify the contact to be deleted

Returns:

The delete_contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

contactapp.views.edit_contact(request, pk)¶

The edit_contact function takes a request and primary key (pk) as arguments. It gets the contact object with the given pk, or returns a 404 error if it doesn’t exist. If the request method is POST, we instantiate ContactForm with the submitted data and also pass in instance=contact so Django populates ContactForm with values from an existing model instance. If form is valid, we save it to database and redirect user to contact list page; otherwise render edit_contact template passing in form variable for displaying validation errors (if any). If request method is GET, we instantiate ContactForm without any data passed in so

Parameters:

  • request – Pass the request object to the view

  • pk – Get the contact object from the database

Returns:

A form to edit the contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

contactapp.views.search_contacts(request)¶

The search_contacts function takes a request object as an argument and returns a rendered template. The function first gets the search_query from the GET data of the request object, then it filters all contacts that belong to the user who made this request. Then it filters those contacts by name, address, phone number, email or birthdate if any of these fields contain the search query string (case insensitive). The filtered results are passed into context dictionary along with the original search query string. Finally we render ‘search_contacts’ template using this context.

Parameters:

request – Get the search query from the url

Returns:

A rendered template

Doc-author:

Trelent

contactapp.views.upcoming_birthdays(request)¶

The upcoming_birthdays function takes a request and returns an HTML page with the contacts that have birthdays within the next x days, where x is specified by the user. The function first checks if it has received a POST request. If so, it gets the number of days from this POST request and converts it to an integer (if possible). It then creates a date object for today’s date and another one for end_date = current_date + timedelta(days=x). It initializes result to be an empty list. Then, it iterates through all of its user’s contacts in order to find those whose

Parameters:

request – Get the request object

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays in the next x days

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contactapp’s forms¶

The forms module contains the forms for the contactapp app.

Contactapp’s urls¶

The module urls is used to map the url to the view function. The url is the path that the user will type in the browser.

param:

you have to pass the path and the view function

return:

path to the template

Contactapp’s tests¶

This file is used to test the contactapp app. But first, you need to create a test database and the tests. To create a test database, use the command: python manage.py migrate –database=test

To run the tests, use the command: python manage.py test contactapp
